properties.Name: 12th St. Oakland City Center (12TH)
properties.descriptio:
1245 Broadway, Oakland CA 94612
12th St. Oakland City Center Station is in the heart of Downtown Oakland, near historic Old Oakland and Oakland's Chinatown.

properties.Name: 16th St. Mission (16TH)
properties.descriptio:
2000 Mission Street, San Francisco CA 94110
"The Mission" refers to the San Francisco de Asis Mission, also known as Mission Dolores, which was founded 1776. Today the neighborhood is host to an eclectic mix of restaurants, markets, performance spac

properties.Name: 19th St. Oakland (19TH)
properties.descriptio:
1900 Broadway, Oakland CA 94612
19th Street Station is in the heart of Uptown Oakland near the historic Paramount Theater on Broadway.

properties.Name: 24th St. Mission (24TH)
properties.descriptio:
2800 Mission Street, San Francisco CA 94110
"The Mission" refers to the San Francisco de Asis Mission, also known as Mission Dolores, which was founded 1776. Today the neighborhood is host to an eclectic mix of restaurants, markets, performance spac

properties.Name: Ashby (ASHB)
properties.descriptio:
3100 Adeline Street, Berkeley CA 94703
Ashby Station is located on Ashby Avenue and Adeline Street in the southern part of Berkeley. On weekends, the City of Berkeley sponsors a popular flea market in the parking lot.

properties.Name: Balboa Park (BALB)
properties.descriptio:
401 Geneva Avenue, San Francisco CA 94112
Balboa Park is the name of both a San Francisco neighborhood and a public park between Mission Street and I-280 north of Geneva Avenue. The park features a public swimming pool, children's playground, baseba

properties.Name: Bay Fair (BAYF)
properties.descriptio:
15242 Hesperian Blvd., San Leandro CA 94578
Bay Fair Station provides easy access to Bayfair Center in San Leandro, one of the first shopping centers built in the East Bay.

properties.Name: Castro Valley (CAST)
properties.descriptio:
3301 Norbridge Dr., Castro Valley CA 94546
Once known for its chicken ranches, Castro Valley was named after Don Guillermo Castro, a local rancher and magistrate in the mid-1800s.

properties.Name: Civic Center/UN Plaza (CIVC)
properties.descriptio:
1150 Market Street, San Francisco CA 94102
Civic Center/UN Plaza Station is nearby some notable San Francisco destinations including including City Hall, War Memorial Opera House, Asian Art Museum, Louise M. Davies Symphony Hall, and the Main Branch

properties.Name: Coliseum/Oakland Airport (COLS)
properties.descriptio:
7200 San Leandro St., Oakland CA 94621
Welcome to Coliseum
Coliseum is the transfer Station that connects BART to the Oakland Int'l Airport Station (OAKL). The station is also connected by a pedestrian bridge to the O.co Coliseum and Oracle Are

properties.Name: Colma (COLM)
properties.descriptio:
365 D Street, Colma CA 94014
The Town of Colma is a diverse community on the San Francisco peninsula that maintains that "small town" feel despite being so close to major cities. The Colma BART Station is close to residential neighborhoods and shopp

properties.Name: Concord (CONC)
properties.descriptio:
1451 Oakland Avenue, Concord CA 94520
Concord is the largest city in Contra Costa County. The Concord BART Station was the "end of the line" until 1995 when the line was extended to Pittsburg/Bay Point.

properties.Name: Daly City (DALY)
properties.descriptio:
500 John Daly Blvd., Daly City CA 94014
Daly City, located at the northernmost edge of San Mateo County, is often called the "Gateway to the Peninsula."

properties.Name: Downtown Berkeley (DBRK)
properties.descriptio:
2160 Shattuck Avenue, Berkeley CA 94704
The Downtown Berkeley BART Station is located on Shattuck Avenue between Allston Way and Addison Street. It is conveniently located close to the University of California campus and to many shops, restaurants,

properties.Name: El Cerrito del Norte (DELN)
properties.descriptio:
6400 Cutting Blvd., El Cerrito CA 94530
Sometimes called simply "del Norte," as the name suggests this station serves the northern part of the City of El Cerrito.

properties.Name: Dublin/Pleasanton (DUBL)
properties.descriptio:
5801 Owens Dr., Pleasanton CA 94588
This unique station straddles the border of Dublin and Pleasanton on Interstate 580. The station features a number of local and regional bus connections.

properties.Name: Embarcadero (EMBR)
properties.descriptio:
298 Market Street, San Francisco CA 94111
Located in San Francisco's Financial District at the foot of Market Street, Embarcadero Station is close to the Ferry Building, Embarcadero Center, Transbay Terminal and the California Street cable car.

properties.Name: Fremont (FRMT)
properties.descriptio:
2000 BART Way, Fremont CA 94536
Fremont Station is an important regional transfer point for service to AC Transit and Santa Clara Transportation Authority (VTA). The city, and the station, are named for American explorer John Charles FrÃ©mont.

properties.Name: Fruitvale (FTVL)
properties.descriptio:
3401 East 12th Street, Oakland CA 94601
Originally called "Fruit Vale," the neighborhood around Fruitvale BART Station was mostly apricot and cherry orchards in the late 1800s. Today, it's a vibrant neighborhood and one of Oakland's main commercial

properties.Name: Glen Park (GLEN)
properties.descriptio:
2901 Diamond Street, San Francisco CA 94131
The Glen Park neighborhood in San Francisco is nestled in a small valley below Diamond Heights, and BART is at the center of the neighborhood on the corner of Diamond and Bosworth Streets.

properties.Name: Hayward (HAYW)
properties.descriptio:
699 'B' Street, Hayward CA 94541
The City of Hayward is known as the "Heart of the Bay" for its central and convenient location in Alameda County. Hayward BART Station is near a pedestrian-friendly downtown with a mix of housing, shops, offices and

properties.Name: Lafayette (LAFY)
properties.descriptio:
3601 Deer Hill Road, Lafayette CA 94549
Centrally located in the East Bay hills, Lafayette exudes a quiet rural atmosphere and features a distinctive downtown.

properties.Name: Lake Merritt (LAKE)
properties.descriptio:
800 Madison Street, Oakland CA 94607
Lake Merritt Station is ideally located near near Oakland Chinatown, Laney College and the Oakland Museum.

properties.Name: MacArthur (MCAR)
properties.descriptio:
555 40th Street, Oakland CA 94609
MacArthur Station is a major BART transfer point near the commercial heart of Temescal, one of north Oakland's oldest neighborhoods.

properties.Name: Millbrae (MLBR)
properties.descriptio:
200 North Rollins Road, Millbrae CA 94030
Situated on an estate formerly owned by Darius Ogden Mills, this city's name derives from "Mills" and the Scottish word "brae" or "rolling hills." Today, the Millbrae BART station is the largest intermodal t

properties.Name: Montgomery St. (MONT)
properties.descriptio:
598 Market Street, San Francisco CA 94104
Located in the heart of San Francisco's Financial District on Market Street, Montgomery Station features excellent access to San Francisco Muni and destinations throughout the city.

properties.Name: North Berkeley (NBRK)
properties.descriptio:
1750 Sacramento Street, Berkeley CA 94702
North Berkeley Station features a unique circular building and offers easy access to the Ohlone Greenway, an East Bay pedestrian and bicycle path.

properties.Name: North Concord/Martinez (NCON)
properties.descriptio:
3700 Port Chicago Highway, Concord CA 94520
The North Concord/Martinez station opened December 16, 1995 and briefly served as "end of the line" until BART completed the Pittsburg/Bay Point extension over Willow Pass in 1996.

properties.Name: Oakland Airport (OAKL)
properties.descriptio:
1 Airport Drive, Oakland CA 94621
Located at the Oakland International Airport, the Oakland Airport station has frequent service to the Coliseum station.

properties.Name: Orinda (ORIN)
properties.descriptio:
11 Camino Pablo, Orinda CA 94563
Originally a rural area known for ranching and summer cabins, today Orinda is primarily a residential community with a rich history that is depicted on a mural and map in the station.

properties.Name: Pleasant Hill/Contra Costa Centre (PHIL)
properties.descriptio:
1365 Treat Blvd., Walnut Creek CA 94597
BART, buses, Highway 680 and the Iron Horse pedestrian and bicycle trail all converge to make this one of BART's most easily accessed stations.

properties.Name: Pittsburg/Bay Point (PITT)
properties.descriptio:
1700 West Leland Road, Pittsburg CA 94565
Pittsburg/Bay Point is a terminal station on the yellow line serving northern and eastern Contra Costa County.

properties.Name: El Cerrito Plaza (PLZA)
properties.descriptio:
6699 Fairmount Avenue, El Cerrito CA 94530
El Cerrito Plaza is one of two BART stations in the City of El Cerrito. It serves southern El Cerrito, northern Albany, Kensington and nearby areas of Berkeley and Richmond.

properties.Name: Powell St. (POWL)
properties.descriptio:
899 Market Street, San Francisco CA 94102
Located at Powell and Market Streets, this station is centrally located near San Francisco's most popular attractions including the cable cars, Union Square, Yerba Buena Gardens, the Moscone Convention Cente

properties.Name: Richmond (RICH)
properties.descriptio:
1700 Nevin Avenue, Richmond CA 94801
Three major railroad tracks, including BART's, help to outline the "Iron Triangle" in Richmond: a largely residential area that also includes the downtown Richmond business district along Macdonald Avenue.

properties.Name: Rockridge (ROCK)
properties.descriptio:
5660 College Avenue, Oakland CA 94618
Named for local rock outcroppings formed by the Hayward Fault, the Rockridge neighborhood is a vibrant residential neighborhood, retail and commercial district in Oakland.

properties.Name: San Leandro (SANL)
properties.descriptio:
1401 San Leandro Blvd., San Leandro CA 94577
Agriculture was an important part of San Leandro's history and cherries were one of the City's most well-known crops. The city's first Cherry Festival was held in 1909 and the tradition still continues to

properties.Name: San Bruno (SBRN)
properties.descriptio:
1151 Huntington Avenue, San Bruno CA 94066
San Bruno Station is next to the city's Tanforan shopping mall and business area. Before becoming a mall, Tanforan was a racetrack, airfield, military center and, during World War II, a Japanese American in

properties.Name: San Francisco Int'l Airport (SFIA)
properties.descriptio:
International Terminal, Level 3, San Francisco Int'l Airport CA 94128
This station is located in the International Terminal at SFO. It's a short walk to United Airlines in Terminal 3, but all domestic terminals (1, 2 & 3) are one to three minute

properties.Name: South Hayward (SHAY)
properties.descriptio:
28601 Dixon Street, Hayward CA 94544
Hayward, originally known as 'Haywards', is named for William Hayward, a New England shoe factory worker who came to California during the Gold Rush.

properties.Name: South San Francisco (SSAN)
properties.descriptio:
1333 Mission Road, South San Francisco CA 94080
Emerging from a portion of old Rancho Buri Buri, South San Francisco occupies the basin and portions of the sides of a broad valley formed by the San Bruno Mountains on the north and the Coast Range on

properties.Name: Union City (UCTY)
properties.descriptio:
10 Union Square, Union City CA 94587
Incorporated in 1959, Union City combined the communities of Alvarado, Decoto, and New Haven. Alvarado was the original county seat of Alameda County, and the site of the first county courthouse is a California H

properties.Name: Warm Springs/South Fremont (WARM)
properties.descriptio:
45193 Warm Springs Blvd, Fremont, CA 94539
Warm Springs/South Fremont Station is currently the most southern station and is the first station to open on the new San Jose extension.

properties.Name: Walnut Creek (WCRK)
properties.descriptio:
200 Ygnacio Valley Road, Walnut Creek CA 94596
The Walnut Creek BART Station is a key piece of infrastructure for a thriving community that can also be characterized as the business and arts center for Contra Costa County.

properties.Name: West Dublin/Pleasanton (WDUB)
properties.descriptio:
6501 Golden Gate Drive, Dublin CA 94568
This station straddles the border of Dublin and Pleasanton on Interstate 580 and is near the Stoneridge Shopping Center. It is BART's 44th station.

properties.Name: West Oakland (WOAK)
properties.descriptio:
1451 7th Street, Oakland CA 94607
The West Oakland BART Station is located in the West Oakland residential and industrial community. The station serves both local residents and riders from throughout the region with its excellent freeway access and

properties.Name: Antioch Station (ANTC)
properties.descriptio:
1600 Slatten Ranch Rd, Antioch, CA 94509
Antioch is a terminal station on the yellow line serving northern and eastern Contra Costa County. It is part of a new rail system that connects to BART's Pittsburg/Bay Point station using state-of-the art Di

properties.Name: Pittsburg Center (PCTR)
properties.descriptio:
2099 Railroad Avenue, Pittsburg, CA 94565
Pittsburg Center is on the yellow line serving northern and eastern Contra Costa County. It is part of a new rail system that connects BART's Pittsburg/Bay Point and Antioch stations using state-of-the art D
